CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 3, 1965, pg. 4, reads: "Smash Window Hazards - The UNPC's War on Decadence, being conducted through its Sanitation and Safety Hazards Committee, placed responsibility for the prevention of vandalism and the breaking of windows in thousands of store and residences in poorer districts in Pittsburgh area squarely on the shoulders of the Department of Public Safety. Here, a Bureau of Building Inspection employe [employee] rips out a ragged plate glass window. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Man, Bureau of Building Inspection employee, breaking out previously broken window of Lee's Confectionery, with Granada Bar next door, Hill District
